title: 106_hr1922
content: The "Citizen Legislature and Political Freedom Act" removes limitations on federal election campaign contributions and terminates taxpayer financing of presidential election campaigns. The "Citizen Legislature and Political Freedom Act" eliminates taxpayer financing of presidential election campaigns starting after December 31, 1999. It also terminates the presidential election campaign fund. The provisions of the "Citizen Legislature and Political Freedom Act" terminate taxpayer financing of presidential election campaigns after December 31, 1999. Excess funds will be transferred to the general fund after December 31, 2000. The "Citizen Legislature and Political Freedom Act" terminates taxpayer financing of presidential election campaigns after December 31, 1999. The provisions of this chapter do not apply to any candidate in presidential elections after December 31, 2000. Clerical amendments are made to update the table of sections in the Code. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to include provisions regarding transfers of funds by national political parties and disclosure requirements for state and local political parties. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to include provisions for state and local political parties to file reports on disbursements with the Commission. The amendments apply to elections after January 2001. SEC. 5. PROMOTING EXPEDITED AVAILABILITY OF FEC REPORTS. Amendment to the Federal Election Campaign Act requires political committees to report all contributions made within 90 days of an election within 24 hours. The Federal Election Campaign Act now mandates that political committees report contributions promptly, including candidate details, contributor identification, and contribution amount. Additionally, the Commission is required to make this information available online within 24 hours of receipt. The amendment made by this section defines the term 'Internet' and applies to reports starting from January 1, 2001. SEC. 6. Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 regarding the identification of contributors making contributions over $200. Effective for contributions made after January 2001.
